frameDefinitions: In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
This frame describes food and meal preparation.
A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.
An Agent performs a series of unspecified tasks to plan for an Event to take place at a Scheduled_time and Place.
A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.
An Agent schedules an Event to take place at a specified Scheduled_time and Place.
frameExamples: Caitlin <t>baked</t> some cookies from the pre-packaged dough.
You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
I've <t>arranged</t> a breakfast meeting for you tomorrow morning with Mr. Huntsberger.
I <t>sent</t> the manuscript to England to Bill.
Gina <t>scheduled</t> a dentist appointment for Monday in Berkeley.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
The <fen>Cook</fen>  prepares the <fen>Produced_food</fen>.
The <fen>Produced_food</fen> is the result of a <fen>Cook</fen>'s efforts.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the cooking creation occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the cooking creation occurs.

The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The person who makes arrangements for the <fen>Event</fen> to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The incident for which the <fen>Agent</fen> has made arrangements.
The time for which the <fen>Agent</fen> has arranged the <fen>Event</fen>.
This role describes the time at which the arrangements are made.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> has made arrangements for the <fen>Event</fen> to take place.
This is the person who initiates the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.

The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
I <t>sent</t> the logs <fex name='Goal'>to the shed</fex>.

The objects being sent.
I mailed <fex name='Theme'>the books</fex> <fex name='Goal'>to Alaska</fex>.
Note that <fen>Theme</fen> may be multiply instantiated.
They <t>mailed</t><fex name='Theme'>a questionnaire</fex> <fex name='Theme'>with a return envelope</fex>.

The mode of sending employed.
I <t>shipped</t> <fex name='Theme'>the crops</fex> <fex name='Transport_means'>by bigrig </fex>.

This is the recipient of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fex name='Sender'>Tess</fex> <t>mailed</t> <fex name='Theme'>a letter</fex> <fex name='Recipient'> to Abby</fex>
When the sending takes place
A spatial setting encomnpassing the Source location, where the Sending event takes place.
The sentient being who schedules an <fen>Event</fen> to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The incident that the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Event</fen> is scheduled to take place.
This role describes the time at which the scheduling occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled the <fen>Event</fen> to take place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
<fex>'I'd like an extension,'</fex> begged Pat.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.
I urged him to concede <fex>yesterday</fex>.
<fex>Drew</fex> cooked dinner for his friends.
Drew prepared <fex>dinner</fex> for his friends.
Drew baked an apple pie <fex>at six int he morning</fex>.
Drew prepared the soup <fex> in the kitchen</fex>.

The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.
<fex>Lucy</fex> organized a playdate for little Michael and Marcy.
I've already made <fex>vacation</fex> arrangements.
I've put together a luncheon <fex>for 12:30</fex>.
Lionel organized a meeting <fex>at the local pub</fex> to discuss the bleak future of our organization.
I sent the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>.
Barney posted the letter on Monday <fex>in Athens</fex>
<fex>I</fex> set up a meeting with Carlos on Monday.
I'd like to set up <fex>a meeting with Mr. Hofmann</fex>.
Maria scheduled the appointment <fex>for Monday</fex>.
Gina scheduled a dentist appointment for Monday <fex>in Berkeley</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Group of Italian Jewish Communities
the Rome Superior Institute of Police Department
the Group of Italian Jewish Communities
